summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and toluene are both identified as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that are commonly emitted into the environment, particularly from fuel and petroleum products. They are part of the BTEX group, which is highlighted due to its hazardous properties and inclusion on the priority substances list established by the European Water Framework Directive. The discussion emphasizes their environmental impact and relevance in wastewater treatment processes, but does not detail any specific interactions between the two compounds.
